fact: Did you know? Light can behave as both a particle and a wave depending on how it is observed.
Did you know? Absolute zero is the lowest possible temperature where atomic motion nearly stops.
Did you know? Water expands when it freezes, which is why ice floats on liquid water.
Did you know? Atoms are mostly empty space, with electrons orbiting a tiny nucleus.
Did you know? Every living organism on Earth is made of one or more cells.
Did you know? DNA carries genetic instructions that determine how organisms grow and function.
Did you know? Earth’s tectonic plates move a few centimeters each year, reshaping the planet slowly.
Did you know? Fossils form when plants or animals are buried quickly and preserved over millions of years.
Did you know? Ecosystems depend on a balance between plants, animals, and microorganisms.
Did you know? Deforestation reduces biodiversity and affects global climate patterns.
Did you know? Vaccines work by training the immune system to recognize and fight diseases.
Did you know? Antibiotics kill bacteria but do not work against viruses.
Did you know? Energy cannot be created or destroyed, only converted from one form to another.
Did you know? Solar energy comes from nuclear reactions happening inside the Sun.
Did you know? Some metals can return to their original shape after being bent, known as shape-memory alloys.
Did you know? Glass is an amorphous solid, meaning it lacks a regular crystal structure.
Did you know? Bananas are naturally radioactive due to their potassium content.
Did you know? Some materials glow in the dark because they store and slowly release energy.
